title: Cannot generate schema for Model that have attributes with nested None
body:
Hey there, first off just wanted to say what a cool implementation this is of data parsing and validation -- definitely like dataclases/attrs with a validation tilt on steroids! :heart_eyes: 

I found this issue the first time using this library (through FastAPI...). I had originally opened a bug report there (https://github.com/tiangolo/fastapi/issues/776), but with @dmontagu's assistance was able to come up with a repro for just pydantic.

# Bug
If appears that when nesting None in default values of attributes, that pydantic cannot handle that case.

## Versions
* OS: Ubuntu 18.04.3
* Python version `import sys; print(sys.version)`: 3.7.4
* Pydantic version `import pydantic; print(pydantic.VERSION)`: 1.2

## Reproduce
```py
from pydantic import BaseModel

class Model(BaseModel):
    state = [None]

Model.schema()
```

## Traceback
```log
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "pydantic/json.py", line 57, in pydantic.json.pydantic_encoder
KeyError: <class 'NoneType'>

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "repro.py", line 6, in <module>
    Model.schema()
  File "pydantic/main.py", line 511, in pydantic.main.BaseModel.schema
  File "pydantic/schema.py", line 146, in pydantic.schema.model_schema
  File "pydantic/schema.py", line 465, in pydantic.schema.model_process_schema
  File "pydantic/schema.py", line 494, in pydantic.schema.model_type_schema
  File "pydantic/schema.py", line 191, in pydantic.schema.field_schema
  File "pydantic/schema.py", line 745, in genexpr
  File "pydantic/schema.py", line 745, in genexpr
  File "pydantic/schema.py", line 749, in pydantic.schema.encode_default
  File "pydantic/json.py", line 59, in pydantic.json.pydantic_encoder
TypeError: Object of type 'NoneType' is not JSON serializable
```
I am taking a look at getting a PR working to fix it in `pydantic.schema.encode_default`. Any feedback or thoughts on that approach?

And thanks again for a great project!
